title: Confusing error message on private newtype field

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

body:
```
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.37.0 (eae3437df 2019-08-13)
```

To reproduce:

```
[dependencies]
actix-web = "1.0.5"
```

```
use actix_web::web;
fn main() {
    let a: web::Query<i32> = web::Query(4);
}
```

`Query` is defined as: `pub struct Query<T>(T);`
Yet, the error message:

```
error[E0423]: expected function, found struct `web::Query`
 --> src/main.rs:3:30
  |
3 |     let a: web::Query<i32> = web::Query(4);
  |                              ^^^^^^^^^^ did you mean `web::Query { /* fields */ }`?

error: aborting due to previous error
```

is confusing in two ways. Firstly, why is a function expected? Secondly, it is wrong in its suggestion.

Interestingly, I was not able to reproduce without any external dependencies:
```
mod m {
    pub struct Query<T>(T);
}
fn main() {
    let a: m::Query<i32> = m::Query(4);
}
```

```
error[E0603]: tuple struct `Query` is private
 --> src/main.rs:6:31
  |
6 |     let a: m::Query<i32> = m::Query(4);
  |                               ^^^^^
```
